subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]  New ideas
author: Frank Ratka
full_text:
--0-1355518425-1244486689=:34902
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

They have a design for a type of lazer listening device that sounds a lot l=
ike your record player. You can bounce the lazer off a window of a house an=
d hear whatever conversation or noise that causes the window to vibrate. Th=
e electric eye you speak of is probably a phototransistor that converts lig=
ht into an electric signal, which can be converted to sound with an 8 ohm s=
peaker.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, threadsintyme@... <Threadsin=
tyme@...> wrote:


From: threadsintyme@... <Threadsintyme@...=
m>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monda=
y, June 8, 2009, 1:38 PM








My parents had on old, old fashioned type =
of record player that dated to the mid 1940's and it had a mirror that boun=
ced a light type of signal off the needle and then to a photoelectric =A0ty=
pe of eye. The music was nice...but getting them old fashioned needles was =
hard. Later we replaced the player with a more modern type of player. Now y=
ou have me wondering where that eye went!!=A0 We switched the players back =
in the mid to late '60's. Gosh! That was like '40 years ago...
Al
---------=
- Original Message ----------
From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =A0New ideas
Date: Mon, =
8 Jun 2009 11:27:16 -0700 (PDT)








On the lazer I used the lazer (I kn=
ow it is spelled laser but i like to use the 'z') as a transmitter. The bea=
m itself is the carrier! As for the spiricom type device I used a couple ch=
eap (29.99) multichannel walkie talkies that you can get at walmart or RS. =
I modified the transmitter side to key the transmitter via computer (evpmak=
er) and added a 9mm jack as an input. I also modified the receiver by addin=
g a 9mm audio jack so I could record with or without ambient noise.
=A0
I d=
on't know if it makes a difference since they seem to know what I'm doing w=
ith me telling them but I told them what frequencies I would transmit at ju=
st in case.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Thre=
adsintyme@ Juno.com> wrote:


From: threadsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@=
 Juno.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Da=
te: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:05 PM




Very interesting, Frank. I remember f=
orm an earlier post today...something that you developed a sort of spiri-co=
m device.=A0 What did you use for the transmitter and receiver?=A0=A0
Al
--=
-------- Original Message ----------
From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo=
.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =A0New ideas
Date=
: Mon, 8 Jun 2009 10:24:10 -0700 (PDT)








One of the techniques I play=
ed with a couple years ago was using lazers. I made a box with a=A0pulse mo=
dulated lazer transmitter and photoelectric receiver. I could either transm=
it ambient room noise (hoping for evp), or any signal I can run through=A0a=
 9mm connection. The clarity was phenomenal but the timing was out of step.=
 I would get loooonnnnggg speech with long tones. I think the frequency of =
the lazer light was too high, which kept it out of sync with whatever level=
 I was talking to at the time. I vowed to use a green or blue lazer (shorte=
r wavelength) to see if it helped but they are pricey so it was put on hold=
.
=A0
Frank R.
